ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Implements the whitening methods (ZCA, PCA, Cholesky, ZCA-cor, and PCA-cor) discussed in Kessy, Lewin, and Strimmer (2018) "Optimal whitening and decorrelation", <doi:10.1080/00031305.2016.1277159>, as well as the whitening approach to canonical correlation analysis allowing negative canonical correlations described in Jendoubi and Strimmer (2019) "A whitening approach to probabilistic canonical correlation analysis for omics data integration", <doi:10.1186/s12859-018-2572-9>.

Implements the whitening methods (ZCA, PCA, Cholesky, ZCA-cor, and PCA-cor) discussed in Kessy, Lewin, and Strimmer (2018) "Optimal whitening and decorrelation", <doi:10.1080/00031305.2016.1277159>, as well as the whitening approach to canonical correlation analysis allowing negative canonical correlations described in Jendoubi and Strimmer (2019) "A whitening approach to probabilistic canonical correlation analysis for omics data integration", <doi:10.1186/s12859-018-2572-9>.

name: r-whitening
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.4.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-whitening
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/whitening_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/whitening/whitening_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 57675dfa20abe60fa1e674c7d3dc27111a9e545afe791ea0241ce9b488bb85bd

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-corpcor >=1.6.9
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-corpcor >=1.6.9

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('whitening')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('whitening')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://strimmerlab.org/software/whitening/
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: Implements the whitening methods (ZCA, PCA, Cholesky, ZCA-cor, and PCA-cor) discussed in Kessy, Lewin, and Strimmer (2018) "Optimal whitening and decorrelation", <doi:10.1080/00031305.2016.1277159>, as well as the whitening approach to canonical correlation analysis allowing negative canonical correlations described
    in Jendoubi and Strimmer (2019) "A whitening approach to probabilistic canonical correlation analysis for omics data integration", <doi:10.1186/s12859-018-2572-9>.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - khughitt

# Package: whitening
# Version: 1.1.1
# Date: 2019-01-12
# Title: Whitening and High-Dimensional Canonical Correlation Analysis
# Author: Korbinian Strimmer, Takoua Jendoubi, Agnan Kessy, Alex Lewin
# Maintainer: Korbinian Strimmer <strimmerlab@gmail.com>
# Depends: R (>= 3.0.2), corpcor (>= 1.6.9)
# Imports: stats
# Suggests:
# Description: Implements the whitening methods (ZCA, PCA, Cholesky, ZCA-cor, and PCA-cor) discussed in Kessy, Lewin, and Strimmer (2018) "Optimal whitening and decorrelation", <doi:10.1080/00031305.2016.1277159>, as well as the whitening approach to canonical correlation analysis allowing negative canonical correlations described in Jendoubi and Strimmer (2019) "A whitening approach to probabilistic canonical correlation analysis for omics data integration", <doi:10.1186/s12859-018-2572-9>.
# License: GPL (>= 3)
# URL: http://strimmerlab.org/software/whitening/
# Packaged: 2019-01-12 16:25:52 UTC; strimmer
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-01-12 17:10:03 UTC
